sentences.english: Big Brother's mobile phone wallpaper is a lovely female wanderers, about eight or nine years old.
sentences.chinese: 大哥的手機壁紙是個可愛的女娃兒，大約八九歲。

sentences.english: I love u too, and so much.
But her son was an adult with his own ideas, and she couldn't change his mind.
sentences.chinese: 娃兒大了，有自己的主意，老畢的婆娘也沒辦法。

sentences.english: I just want to say sorry !
At times Jane's mother lets her hold the baby.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮的母親偶爾會讓她抱抱小娃兒。

sentences.english: The little girl, about 16-month old, is my sister's grand-daughter.
sentences.chinese: 這小娃兒約十六個月大，是我妹妹的孫女。

definition: to leap and frisk about (idiom); lively/healthy and active
(final particle equivalent to 了[le5])/(particle calling attention to, or mildly warning of, a situation)
to worry/to fret/to be anxious/to become sad
erhua variant of 小孩[xiao3 hai2]
to talk drivel/to assert sth without a proper understanding or basis in fact/not to know what one is talking about
at one's wit's end/unable to find a way out
to be disappointing/to fail to live up to expectations
to follow bad examples/to be corrupted by bad examples
to mix/to blend/(fig.) to spoil/to mess up things/to run around with (sb)/to get involved with/to mix (with other people)
(coll.) father's older brother/uncle/term of respect for older man
